pkgmetadata.longdescription:
I2P is an anonymous network providing strong privacy protections for communication over the Internet. Many activities that would risk your privacy on the public Internet can be conducted anonymously inside I2P.
I2P exposes a simple layer that applications can use to anonymously and securely send messages to each other. The network itself is strictly message-based (ala IP), but provides a library allowing reliable streaming communication on top of that (ala TCP). All communication is end-to-end encrypted: in total, four layers of encryption are used when sending a message. Even the end points (i.e., destinations) are cryptographic identifiers essentially consisting of a pair of public keys.
I2P est un reseau anonyme que les applications peuvent utilise pour s'envoyer des messages.
